other_tests.findings: Confirmed that the twins were indeed identical twins, matching at all loci studied.
Successful breast reconstruction using a DIEP flap from the donor twin with an uncomplicated postoperative course.
Successful breast reconstruction with a SIEA flap; however, distal inferior lateral aspect showed signs of ischemia, requiring debridement.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Patient did very well after debridement and was discharged the following day.

other_tests.procedure_name: Breast reconstruction using bilateral DIEP flaps
other_tests.findings: Successful bilateral breast reconstruction with two DIEP flaps from the donor twin, both sisters were discharged postoperatively without complication.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Three months post-operation, recipient twin required bilateral nipple reconstruction and flap revisions due to contracture.

other_tests.findings: Fat harvested from the donor twin and injected into the recipient twin's left reconstructed breast for contour correction.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Estimated a 40 percent take of the fat graft at 11 months post-operation.
